```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(kNN)

```
After calling kNN, use kNN or kNN_R to get knn results.
```{r}
train <- rbind(iris3[1:25,,1], iris3[1:25,,2], iris3[1:25,,3])
test <- rbind(iris3[26:50,,1], iris3[26:50,,2], iris3[26:50,,3])
cl <- factor(c(rep("s",25), rep("c",25), rep("v",25)))
preds = kNN(train, test, cl, k = 10, prob=TRUE, use.all = TRUE)
probs=attributes(preds)$prob
```

See the accuracy of the algorithm.
```{r}
cl_gt <- factor(c(rep("s",25), rep("c",25), rep("v",25)))
accuracy = sum(preds == cl_gt) / length(cl_gt)
accuracy
```
